intro: Seddera pedunculata, commonly known as the clustered seddera, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to conserve water. Its leaves are usually narrow and succulent, while the flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. Seddera pedunculata is often found in rocky soils and can thrive in poor nutrient conditions.
